snippet: Parts of several pipes will be tested at a laboratory in Washington as part of the investigation into the deadly gas explosion that destroyed two buildings in East Harlem last month.
abstract: Parts of several pipes will be tested at a laboratory in Washington, DC, as part of investigation into the deadly gas explosion in East Harlem; investigators have finished work at the scene of the March 12 blast on Park Avenue near 116th Street, which destroyed two buildings and killed eight people.
lead_paragraph: Parts of several pipes will be tested at a laboratory in Washington as part of the investigation into the deadly gas explosion that destroyed two buildings in East Harlem last month.

headline.main: Gas Pipes From East Harlem Blast to Undergo Further Tests
headline.print_headline: Gas Pipes From Blast to Undergo Further Tests
